page.title: 11SHOPS
page.content: In Wearhead there are 4 shops - a Co-operative Store, a Post Office and General Shop, a butcher and newsagent. There is only 1 small General Shop in Ireshopeburn. Mobile Shops visit the area once or twice a week, including 2 selling groceries and vegetables, a fishmonger who also sells eggs and butter, a butcher and a green grocer. Bread is delivered to local shops from bakeries outside the area. Draperies can be bought in St.John's Chapel but most people buy their clothes in neighbouring towns or from mail order catalogues. Hardware is sold at the Co-op. in Wearhead and St.John's Chapel. Farmers' wives may prefer to shop at Hexham when their husbands go to the Mart and those with cars may also shop there or at Stanhope, Crook or Bishop Auckland.
